title: Clarity and Clairvoyance removal
body:
According to Riot 'nobody' uses these summoners anymore. So does this mean i'm a nobody to them because i use both of these summoners on certain champs regularly. 

Just want to see other peoples opinion on this matter am I really the only one still using them?

replies.body: They're bad spells which aren't needed in the game.
How is getting back 40% your mana and teammates mana bad?

> [{quoted}](name=GCSBBlitzForever,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=l7Jt4AjI,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-11T22:13:29.186+0000)
>
> How is getting back 40% your mana and teammates mana bad?

A few reasons.

1. A lot of popular champions don't use mana.
2. Most of the time there won't be a point in the game where your team will desperately need to get a ton of mana back which makes the spell pointless unless you're mucking around and playing a complete siege comp that will just spam continuously.
3. Other spells can be used more often and for greater value like TP, Ignite, Cleanse, Heal, Barrier, Flash.
4. Even if you're playing a hardcore siege comp, it's likely that most of your team will be AP, which means they can just buy Grail instead.

Grail and Scrying Orb are both better than Clarity/Clairvoyance.

Oh jk, they removed Scrying Orb.

I use clairvoyance when i play lux support for things like stealing buffs/drags/barons it works very well when you don't wanna risk invading but your team gave your blue to the mid and you want one to you just time using it correctly and easy blue buff. also map aware ness eg checking where enemy is leashing to attempt a potential invade on there opposite jg. I don't know what everybody is on about saying it's useless i find it extremely useful.

Hey man,

The patch notes provide some more insight

> Simply put, these Summoners were caught in a space where they'd either never be picked or be too powerful to not pick, given the tuning (hint: it was always the former). As such, keeping these spells around served as a trap for those poor, unfortunate souls who took them, so we're laying them to rest. Say hey to Fortify, Promote and Surge for us.
>

then instead of removal them which was the which and easy way.
Why didn't you change them like you did heal?

Heal you just added some extra stuff + move speed them it became a MUST HAVE for some characters.
Why don;t you also add that Speed boost to clarity?

Or have it so clairvoyance offers more then just temp vision.

Just because the MINORITY, don't use those spells doesn't mean there bad. 
At least they are there, in case someone does want to use them.

If you going about like this, your eventually gonna be left with 4 summoner spells and start re,moving champions becuase no one plays them anymore.

What else could Clairvoyance offer? Permanent vision won't work. Perhaps a temporary mark that applies to anyone spotted and increases allied movement speed/damage towards those marked?

Spells aren't picked by a majority because they're not as good as other spells. It's a rare (and I mean practically never) case in which clarity is better to take over Ignite, TP, Heal, Barrier, Exhaust etc.

As for your point about removing champions, that's a completely different concept. Champions can be actively nerfed/buffed/reworked or the meta can shift to support them because they're far more diverse and flexible than spells.

It doesn't matter whats better to take over anything.    It was about choice and  customization.     If your just gonna remove things that don't work best IN YOUR OPINION,  why not just remove them all,  why make us choose summoner spells and just chose them for us?   You OBVIOUSLY KNOW BEST.   and MY OPINION doesn't count.    Make all tanks come standard with heal and  exhaust,   make all adc come standard with heal, barrier...   What are you trying to prove by giving us less options to customize how WE WANT TO PLAY.

Why make us pick items as well...   just auto shop for us cause it's WHATS BEST IN YOUR OPINION.

Clairvoyance was a major common spell for me to use.   it eliminated my need to wander thru the jg or river and get caught out trying to place a ward when i had NO clue where they were.

Clarity...   Came in great for a little longer lane presence on mana hungry characters like Panth, or Galio or Nasus.   Now instead of this spell  I find myself buying a dorans ring as first item on panth when i need the extra poke.   WHO THE HELL DOES THAT????     i do.    cause I find having extra mana fita my play style better than ignite or teleport.

This exactly, Nemmesis2. If Riot are really commited to diversity they would have left these summoners in the game. Oh, and the power to create your own Item Sets is being removed in the upcoming new client, r.i.p. to Ekko's ulting back from the fountain with their own choices, unless you use third party hacks, which could possibily cop a ban (who knows).

I don't know why they remove things from the game, when those things don't do any harm to leave them in the game.
Sure you might've found them useful, but the point is that in pretty much every situation there was another option that was MORE useful

Pro's:
-----------
- Mana boost when needed for a kill or an escape

Cons:
-----------
- Not many people use Clarity or Clairvoyance
- Clairvoyance isn't that useful, considering the cooldown on the spell

-------

Instead, they should add a mana restore on the [b]Heal[/b] summoner spell, or create a new one called "Boost"

"Boost" could refund a small portion of HP, Mana and give you a small speed boost also.
Downside to boost? The cooldown could be high, or perhaps you need to be below a certain amount of HP in order to activate.

-

All in all - Neither are really necessary, yet I'd like to see Riot keep a mana refund spell - energy included.

last time I got to use clairvoyance I remember the cooldown being around 50 seconds. (meaning you can pretty much track where the enemy jg is based off of the camps missing and ones still up)

but yes your boost idea doesn't sound bad.

Oh, last time I used it was about 3 - 5 months ago haha.
If it was that useful, perhaps they should instead create the "**Support**" summoner spell.

- If you select the **Support** spell, you can buy something like {{item:3363}}, which could have a lesser cooldown or greater distance
- **Support** spell will grant mana return + a small boost of movement speed

This way, you're not altering heal, yet support has its own summoner spell if it need be.

Why they would remove these summoners at the same patch scrying orb and mana potions are is beyond me,

Clairvoyance would've been great on global ulti champs that still want wards
Clarity would've been great on early game lane bullies that need a lot of mana

I understand tweaking numbers before S6 would've broken these abilities, but with these changes to entire gameplay strategies, I think you should've given them a chance.

Well clairvoyance got shifted across to the far sight upgrade for trinket i assume, and clarity well that was a fairly logic removal, 1. was kinda garbage, 2 they removed blue pots because certain champions benefit significantly more from 100 mana than others, the same can be said for restoring % of max mana, most niche play with it would something along the lines of getting bursted so you use clarity to restore your mana so you can archangel for more except heal would just be better here, and clarity is absolute garbage late game cause unless your team is super heavy poke oriented your not running out of mana during the team fight, mid has blue so no mana troubles there top gonna have better 2nd summoners to take, adcs should never take it, same with jungler, which leaves support who should really either be taking exhaust or ignite, to assist in actually being useful in fights.

Yep "or be too powerful to not pick" but if you don't take flash in every game you get called everything toxic, AND toxic. Delete Flash for being too powerful, then you might have a reason to get rid of a SS that gives back a large portion of mana which some people want and get use out of.
